1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Set-like operation.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Base.List.Set
6  ( duplicates, duplicated,
7    unique,
8    uniqueConcat,
9    unionUp,
10    keepMember, omitMember, sublist,
11    setList, setEq,
12    disjoint, overlap,
13  ) where
14
15import qualified Data.List                      as List
16import qualified Data.Set                       as Set
17import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture       as O
18
19
20-- | Extract duplicate elements.
21--
22--   >>> duplicates "banana"
23--   "ana"
24--
25--   >>> duplicates "grape"
26--   ""
27--
28duplicates :: (Ord a) => [a] -> [a]
29duplicates xs = loop xs Set.empty where
30    loop [] _ = []
31    loop (x:xs2) set
32        | Set.member x set = x : loop xs2 set
33        | otherwise        = loop xs2 (Set.insert x set)
34
35-- | Test list has duplicated elements.
36--
37--   >>> duplicated "banana"
38--   True
39--
40--   >>> duplicated "grape"
41--   False
42--
43duplicated :: (Ord a) => O.Test [a]
44duplicated = not . null . duplicates
45
46-- | Remove duplicate elements.
47--
48--   >>> unique "banana"
49--   "ban"
50--
51unique :: (Ord a) => [a] -> [a]
52unique xs = loop xs Set.empty where
53    loop [] _ = []
54    loop (x:xs2) set
55        | Set.member x set = loop xs2 set
56        | otherwise        = x : loop xs2 (Set.insert x set)
57
58-- | Collect elements in occurence order.
59--
60--   >>> uniqueConcat ["apple", "banana", "cocoa"]
61--   "aplebnco"
62--
63uniqueConcat :: (Ord a) => [[a]] -> [a]
64uniqueConcat = unique . concat
65
66-- | Union list to base list.
67--
68--   >>> unionUp "cde" "abc"
69--   "deabc"
70--
71--   >>> List.union "cde" "abc"
72--   "cdeab"
73--
74unionUp :: (Eq a) => [a] -> [a] -> [a]
75unionUp xs ys = (xs List.\\ ys) ++ ys
76
77-- | Filter by set membership.
78--   @keepMember@ /A/ /B/ is same to the intersection of /A/ and /B/,
79--   except for the ordering of /B/ is preserved.
80--
81--   >>> keepMember "cba" "abcdefg"
82--   "abc"
83--
84--   >>> keepMember "abcdefg" "cba"
85--   "cba"
86--
87{-# DEPRECATED keepMember "Use 'selectShare' instead." #-}
88keepMember :: (Ord a) => [a] -> [a] -> [a]
89keepMember xs = filter (`Set.member` Set.fromList xs)
90
91-- | Anti-filter by set membership.
92--   @omitMember@ /A/ /B/ is same to /B/ minus /f/A,
93--   except for the ordering of /B/ is preserved.
94--
95--   >>> omitMember "cba" "abcdefg"
96--   "defg"
97--
98--   >>> omitMember "abcdefg" "cba"
99--   ""
100--
101{-# DEPRECATED omitMember "Use 'selectRight' instead." #-}
102omitMember :: (Ord a) => [a] -> [a] -> [a]
103omitMember xs = filter (`Set.notMember` Set.fromList xs)
104
105-- | Test sublist.
106--
107--   >>> sublist "cab" "abcdefg"
108--   True
109--
110--   >>> sublist "cab" "dec"
111--   False
112--
113sublist :: (Ord a) => [a] -> [a] -> Bool
114sublist xs ys = null $ omitMember ys xs
115
116-- | Convert to set-like list, in other words,
117--   remove duplicate elements and sort list.
118--
119--   >>> setList "abracadabra"
120--   "abcdr"
121--
122setList :: (Ord a) => [a] -> [a]
123setList = Set.toAscList . Set.fromList
124
125-- | Set-like equality, in other words, 
126--   duplication and ordering are ignored.
127--
128--   >>> setEq "abc" "bca"
129--   True
130--
131--   >>> setEq "abc" "ab"
132--   False
133--
134setEq :: (Ord a) => [a] -> [a] -> Bool
135setEq xs ys = (Set.fromList xs) == (Set.fromList ys)
136
137-- | Test two list has no elements in common.
138--
139--   >>> disjoint "abc" "de"
140--   True
141--
142--   >>> disjoint "abc" "cde"
143--   False
144--
145disjoint :: (Eq a) => [a] -> [a] -> Bool
146disjoint a b = null (a `List.intersect` b)
147
148-- | Test two list has some common elements.
149--
150--   >>> overlap "abc" "de"
151--   False
152--
153--   >>> overlap "abc" "cde"
154--   True
155--
156overlap :: (Eq a) => [a] -> [a] -> Bool
157overlap a b = not $ disjoint a b
158
